definitions.definition: a building, column, statue, etc. built to remind people of a famous person or event

examples.text: A monument to him was erected in St Paul's Cathedral.
Monuments to the former leader were all pulled down.
The monument will stand just inside the cathedral.
The museum was built as a lasting monument to the civil war.
The tower stands as a monument to the invasion of the island.
monuments of the army's past campaigns
The new boat is a fitting monument to the crew members who lost their lives.

definitions.definition: a building that has special historical importance

examples.text: Some of the town's Roman monuments still survive.
the best preserved Roman monument in Britain

definitions.definition: a thing that remains as a good example of somebody’s qualities or of what they did

examples.text: These recordings are a monument to his talent as a pianist.

wordOrigin: Middle English (denoting a burial place): via French from Latin monumentum, from monere ‘remind’.
